titleStmt.title: George W. Swoops to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2009

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Owensboro Ky
Jany 4th 1865
Thos E Bramlette
Governor of Ky

Dr Sir -- : Enclosed I send you a petition signed by some of the most responsible & best citizens of our county the object of which is Set forth in the petition. I can say to you that Mr I P Washburn will answer the purpose he is an aged man and has filed more important positions than the one he applies for now. Among the Signatures to his peitition you will find that of Jesse Moon Post Master of our town. W. P. McFarland County Atty. and Ray D Hardin Attys of some reputation I mention this for the reason that since Mr Washburn has applied Mr A. G. Botts has written you on the subject and annother appointment
